post.description:

message: str

dict[str, str]
    A dictionary containing the ID of the created task.

Get information about a specific background task.

Parameters
----------

    The ID of the task.

Returns
-------
Optional[dict[str, Any]]
    A dictionary containing information about the task if found, or None otherwise.

post.description:
Create a complete SIP setup including:
- Inbound trunk
- Outbound trunk
- Dispatch rule
- Agent association (if agent IDs are provided)

This single API call handles everything needed for SIP integration.

get.description: List all SIP trunks owned by the current user.
Get details of a specific SIP trunk.

delete.description: Delete a SIP trunk configuration and its LiveKit resources.

schema.title: Response Delete Sip Trunk Api V1 Sip Trunk  Trunk Id  Delete

post.description: Create a new SIP agent mapping for an existing trunk.

put.description: Update an existing SIP agent mapping to change the agent.

schema.title: Response Update Sip Agent Mapping Api V1 Sip Agent Mapping  Mapping Id  Put

get.description: Get details of a specific SIP agent mapping.
List all SIP agent mappings with optional filtering by trunk_id.

schema.title: Response List Sip Agent Mappings Api V1 Sip Agent Mapping Get

post.description:
Initiate outbound SIP calls to one or more phone numbers.

This endpoint will:
1. Create a new room for each call
2. Associate the agent with the room
3. Initiate the SIP call to the specified number
4. Track the call in the database

Only superusers can initiate outbound calls.

get.description: Get status information for a SIP call.

List SIP calls with optional filtering.

Supports filtering by:
- phone_number: Filter by phone number
- direction: Filter by INBOUND or OUTBOUND
- status: Filter by call status  
- trunk_id: Filter by SIP trunk
- agent_id: Filter by agent

schema.title: Response List Calls Api V1 Calls Get

post.description: Assign function tools to an agent profile.

get.description: Get the function tools assigned to an agent profile.

delete.description: Remove a function tool from an agent profile.

post.description:
Create a new function tool.

## Make.com Configuration Tips:

When configuring function tools for Make.com webhooks:

1. **Response Handling**: Make.com typically returns a simple "Accepted" text response.
   - Leave `response_mapping` empty (or set to `{}`) to handle this automatically
   - The system will automatically interpret "Accepted" as a successful operation

2. **Request Template**: If using a specific data structure for Make.com:
   - Use the `request_template` field to define your data structure
   - Example: `{"name": "${name}", "phone": "${phone_number}"}`
   - Parameters will be substituted using `${parameter_name}` syntax

3. **Common Configuration Example for Make.com**:
   ```json
   {
     "http_method": "POST",
     "base_url": "https://hook.eu2.make.com",
     "endpoint_path": "/your-webhook-id",
     "headers": {"Content-Type": "application/json"},
     "request_template": {},  // Use empty for direct parameter passing
     "response_mapping": {}   // Leave empty for automatic "Accepted" handling
   }
   ```

The system automatically handles Make.com's "Accepted" response and will return:
`{"success": true, "message": "Operation accepted"}`

get.description: List function tools owned by the current user and optionally public tools.
